medical_history.chief_complaint: A 26-month-old girl presented with typical features of hypophosphatemic rickets, short stature, and iron deficiency.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The girl's symptoms included poor growth, genua vara, and a waddling gait. Physical examination and x-rays showed severe rickets. Biochemical profile improvement was noted with treatment, although her height remained reduced for age.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Iron deficiency; previously treated for rickets with elemental phosphorus and calcitriol.
medical_history.family_history: The father had presented with rickets at age 11 months that resolved without treatment, requiring corrective leg surgery. Father and daughter share a heterozygous mutation in the FGF23 gene confirming Autosomal Dominant Hypophosphatemic Rickets (ADHR).
